ygData.subject: RE: Char Carillion
ygData.msgSnippet: Hehe.. Came up with a ncikname for you, Shada l33t zOmB33 (Elite Zombie) lol=) (Hopefully you get it) ... From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
ygData.messageBody:
Hehe.. Came up with a ncikname for you, Shada

l33t zOmB33
(Elite Zombie)
lol=)
(Hopefully you get it)

-----Original Message-----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
[mailto:Michael.Garramone@...]
Sent: Saturday, January 08, 2000 3:33 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Char Carillion


From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <Michael.Garramone@...>

it is not a charisma song per se as has been said by others, but like you
mention it is simply a faction song. it absolutely has a difference with a
flute. example, in west commons i went to the inn and was told to get the
heck out. sing carillion, get the heck out. play carillion with a flute,
Hello Shada you might find an orc pick handy...

Shada Bladestorm, L50 Wood Elf Bard
Tyria Sarkin, L35 High Elf Wizard
<Afterlife> Mithaniel Marr Server


>
> Ok, here's the deal on Carillion. If you don't have line of
> sight, it sometimes won't work. As it says
> in the various song analyses, All this does is Give you the
> factions that the mob you targets has This
> can have various effects on the /con. Most of the time, this
> will improve on how they view you.
> Sometimes, however, you can have better or the same faction
> with them already. Other times, the mob has
> no faction, like gypsies, so the song does nothing. This
> song will not make a monster who is "ready to
> attack" you non-aggro. It has been debated whether using a
> wind instrument has any effect on this song.
> My opinion is that it doesn't.
